definitions.definition: In civil law , a case where two or more people disagree and one or more of the parties take the case to a court for resolution .
examples: The lawyer advised his client against filing a lawsuit as it would take a lot of time and money to resolve.
My ex-fiancé filed a lawsuit against me for a false restraining order and defamation .

main_definition: ( law ) In civil law , a case where two or more people disagree and one or more of the parties take the case to a court for resolution .
